document.title: Health Education Content Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FAEDA390DFE3013194B168A86D17958E.description: Support others in making positive and healthful choices about sexual behavior.

FAED40F0DFE3013194B068A86D17958E.description: Advocate the respect for and the dignity of persons living with HIV or AIDS.

FAECE7E0DFE3013194AF68A86D17958E.description: Encourage and support safe, respectful, and responsible relationships.

FAEC8350DFE3013194AE68A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

FAEC2850DFE3013194AD68A86D17958E.description: Describe personal actions that can protect sexual and reproductive health (including one's ability to deliver a healthy baby in adulthood).

FAEBBFF0DFE3013194AC68A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

FAEB4150DFE3013194AB68A86D17958E.description: Identify short- and long-term goals related to abstinence and maintaining reproductive and sexual health, including the use of FDA-approved condoms and other contraceptives for pregnancy and STD prevention.

FAEACF80DFE3013194AA68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate how HIV, AIDS, other STDs, or pregnancy could impact life goals.

FAEA7D00DFE3013194A968A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

FAEA2DD0DFE3013194A868A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to evaluate the use of FDA-approved condoms and other contraceptives for pregnancy and STD prevention.

FAE9DD90DFE3013194A768A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to evaluate the social, emotional, physical, and economic effects of teen pregnancy on the child, the teen parent, the family, and society.

FAE98B90DFE3013194A668A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to analyze the benefits of respecting individual differences in growth and development, physical appearance, gender roles, and sexual orientation.

FAE935B0DFE3013194A568A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the risks and consequences associated with sexual activities, including HIV, other STDs, and pregnancy.

FAE8E740DFE3013194A468A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to analyze when it is necessary to seek help with or leave an unhealthy situation.

FAE89790DFE3013194A368A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to examine barriers to making healthy decisions about relationships and sexual health.

FAE841A0DFE3013194A268A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to evaluate the physical, emotional, and social benefits of abstinence, monogamy, and the avoidance of multiple sexual partners.

FAE7E220DFE3013194A168A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

FAE78810DFE3013194A068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate effective communication skills within healthy dating relationships.

FAE73AB0DFE30131949F68A86D17958E.description: Use effective verbal and nonverbal communication skills to prevent sexual involvement, HIV, other STDs, and pregnancy

FAE6EC20DFE30131949E68A86D17958E.description: Analyze how interpersonal communication affects relationships.

FAE69880DFE30131949D68A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

FAE64480DFE30131949C68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate laws related to sexual involvement with minors.

FAE5E350DFE30131949B68A86D17958E.description: Compare the success and failure rates of FDA-approved condoms and other contraceptives in preventing HIV, other STDs, and pregnancy.

FAE58F40DFE30131949A68A86D17958E.description: Identify local resources concerning reproductive and sexual health, including all FDA-approved contraceptives, HIV/STD testing, and medical care.

FAE53A50DFE30131949968A86D17958E.description: Analyze the validity of health information, products, and services related to reproductive and sexual health.

FAE4E480DFE30131949868A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FAE48980DFE30131949768A86D17958E.description: Evaluate how culture, media, and other people influence perceptions about body image, gender roles, sexuality, attractiveness, relationships, and sexual orientation.

FAE426F0DFE30131949668A86D17958E.description: Assess situations that could lead to pressure for sexual activity and to the risk of HIV, other STDs, and pregnancy

FAE3C470DFE30131949568A86D17958E.description: Assess the discrepancies between actual and perceived social norms related to sexual activity among teenagers.

FAE369D0DFE30131949468A86D17958E.description: Evaluate how growth and development, relationships, and sexual behaviors are affected by internal and external influences.

FAE2FDC0DFE30131949368A86D17958E.description: Determine personal, family, school, and community factors that can help reduce the risk of engaging in sexual activity.

FAE291D0DFE30131949268A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FAE21A40DFE30131949168A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the safety and effectiveness (including success and failure rates) of FDA-approved condoms and other contraceptives in preventing HIV, other STDs, and pregnancy.

FAE1CBF0DFE30131949068A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the benefits to mother, father, and child when teenagers wait until adulthood to become parents.

FAE17B90DFE30131948F68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that there are individual differences in growth and development, physical appearance, gender roles, and sexual orientation.

FAE12730DFE30131948E68A86D17958E.description: Explain laws related to sexual behavior and the involvement of minors.

FAE071D0DFE30131948C68A86D17958E.description: Describe the short- and long-term effects of HIV, AIDS, and other STDs.

FAE02200DFE30131948B68A86D17958E.description: Explain responsible prenatal and perinatal care and parenting, including California's Safely Surrendered Baby Law.

FADFCED0DFE30131948A68A86D17958E.description: Summarize fertilization, fetal development, and childbirth.

FADF7A00DFE30131948968A86D17958E.description: Identify why abstinence is the most effective method for the prevention of HIV, other STDs, and pregnancy.

FADF1CE0DFE30131948868A86D17958E.description: Discuss the characteristics of healthy relationships, dating, committed relationships, and marriage.

FADEB7E0DFE30131948768A86D17958E.description: Explain how conception occurs, the stages of pregnancy, and the responsibilities of parenting.

FADE55A0DFE30131948668A86D17958E.description: Describe physical, social, and emotional changes associated with being a young adult.

FADDF120DFE30131948568A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

FADD42A0DFE30131948368A86D17958E.description: Encourage societal and environmental conditions that benefit health.

FADCE820DFE30131948268A86D17958E.description: Support personal or consumer health issues that promote community wellness.

FADC6720DFE30131948168A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

FADBF870DFE30131948068A86D17958E.description: Describe the steps involved in breast or testicular self-exams.

FADB8520DFE30131947F68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the proper steps for protecting oneself against the harmful effects of the sun.

FADB3700DFE30131947E68A86D17958E.description: Execute a plan for maintaining good personal hygiene (including oral hygiene) and getting adequate rest and sleep.

FADAE5A0DFE30131947D68A86D17958E.description: Analyze environmental barriers to adopting positive personal health practices and strategies for overcoming the barriers.

FADA9230DFE30131947C68A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

FADA4050DFE30131947B68A86D17958E.description: Develop a plan of preventive dental health management.

FAD9E490DFE30131947A68A86D17958E.description: Develop a plan of preventive health management.

FAD985C0DFE30131947968A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

FAD925E0DFE30131947868A86D17958E.description: Analyze the possible consequences of risky hygienic and health behaviors and fads (e.g., tattooing, body piercing, sun exposure, and sound volume).

FAD8C350DFE30131947768A86D17958E.description: Analyze how using alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs influences health and other behaviors.

FAD87210DFE30131947668A86D17958E.description: Apply a decision-making process to a community or environmental health issue.

FAD81350DFE30131947568A86D17958E.description: Explain how decisions regarding health behaviors have consequences for oneself and others.

FAD7C030DFE30131947468A86D17958E.description: Apply a decision-making process to a personal health issue or problem.

FAD768A0DFE30131947368A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

FAD702E0DFE30131947268A86D17958E.description: Use effective communication skills to ask for assistance from parents, guardians, and medical or dental health care professionals to enhance health.

FAD68130DFE30131947168A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

FAD62F90DFE30131947068A86D17958E.description: Assess ways to be a responsible consumer of health products and services.

FAD5DFF0DFE30131946F68A86D17958E.description: Identify government and community agencies that promote health and protect the environment.

FAD59190DFE30131946E68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate current research about the health consequences of poor environmental conditions.

FAD54220DFE30131946D68A86D17958E.description: Access valid information about common diseases.

FAD4E940DFE30131946C68A86D17958E.description: Access valid information about personal health products and services available in the community

FAD485C0DFE30131946B68A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FAD43840DFE30131946A68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the need for rest, sleep, and exercise.

FAD3E960DFE30131946968A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the benefits of informed health choices.

FAD39A40DFE30131946868A86D17958E.description: Analyze the social influences that encourage or discourage sun-safety practices.

FAD34600DFE30131946768A86D17958E.description: Discuss ways to stay informed about environmental issues.

FAD2F1B0DFE30131946668A86D17958E.description: Analyze how environmental conditions affect personal and community health.

FAD29610DFE30131946568A86D17958E.description: Evaluate influences on the selection of personal health care products and services.

FAD24300DFE30131946468A86D17958E.description: Discuss influences that affect positive health practices.

FAD1DD00DFE30131946368A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FAD17B80DFE30131946268A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to reduce pollution and harmful health effects (e.g., by using alternative methods of transportation).

FAD109B0DFE30131946168A86D17958E.description: Describe the impact of air and water pollution on health.

FAD061B0DFE30131945F68A86D17958E.description: Examine ways to prevent and manage asthma.

FAD013A0DFE30131945E68A86D17958E.description: Explain how public health policies and government regulations influence health promotion and disease prevention.

FACFC430DFE30131945D68A86D17958E.description: Identify the importance of medical screenings (including breast, cervical, testicular, and prostate examinations, and other testing) necessary to maintain reproductive health.

FACF6FB0DFE30131945C68A86D17958E.description: Examine common types and symptoms of cancer.

FACF17E0DFE30131945B68A86D17958E.description: Identify symptoms that indicate a need for an ear, eye, or dental examination.

FACEC790DFE30131945A68A86D17958E.description: Describe the dangers of exposure to ultraviolet (UV) light, lead, asbestos, pesticides, and unclean air and water; and discuss strategies for avoiding exposure.

FACE7340DFE30131945968A86D17958E.description: Investigate the causes and symptoms of communicable and noncommunicable diseases.

FACE1DE0DFE30131945868A86D17958E.description: Identify types of pathogens that cause disease.

FACDC510DFE30131945768A86D17958E.description: Identify symptoms that should prompt individuals to seek health care.

FACD6460DFE30131945668A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the importance of regular medical and dental checkups, vaccinations, and examinations.

FACD0BA0DFE30131945568A86D17958E.description: Discuss the value of actively managing personal health behaviors (e.g., getting adequate sleep, practicing ergonomics, and performing self-examinations).

FACCACF0DFE30131945468A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

83EDC2A3472941A987194B1E4D132E5B.description: Object appropriately to teasing of peers and community members that is based on perceived personal characteristics and sexual orientation.

F16D5E9AB44741DD801C7C9523462A88.description: Promote a positive and respectful environment at school and in the community

E000B15BF76543AABCD2ABE2181387E3.description: Support the needs and rights of others regarding mental and social health.

FACBEC50DFE30131945268A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

3694C93CD79C40F5997987BC2E2C1C14.description: Practice setting personal boundaries in a variety of situations.

1293FEADD92D44A49227A2F90C6058B2.description: Participate in clubs, organizations, and activities in the school and in the community that offer opportunities for student and family involvement.

8526FB9CA9CD4006858937B03D9A492E.description: Practice respect for individual differences and diverse backgrounds.

F52E84DB968B4ADC92D97E2561838F1B.description: Practice effective coping mechanisms and strategies for managing stress.

38FA7A0A60EC4D4DB9FE7FC7C3A75F9E.description: Assess personal patterns of response to stress and use of resources.

FACB6570DFE30131945168A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

0E2A0C5B397A453FB9281F85A7EA3757.description: Set a goal to reduce life stressors in a health-enhancing way.

5F98E0D78B9D467D868EA93852F43589.description: Evaluate how preventing and managing stress and getting help for mental and social problems can help a person achieve short- and long-term goals.

FACAF9B0DFE30131945068A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

FBDF442BDFE84C49A3C941B35A253516.description: Analyze situations when it is important to seek help with stress, loss, an unrealistic body image, and depression.

E3A4665E27F7482C941CF976B4768F2E.description: Compare various coping mechanisms for managing stress.

661813047961491B8B7BD8FC2ABE91C4.description: Monitor personal stressors and assess techniques for managing them.

FACAAA60DFE30131944F68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

E7B002F60B1D406AACAE6CBA69647BEF.description: Discuss healthy ways to respond when you or someone you know is grieving.

39F11AF6B4294C20BDF8883BC76A8B7E.description: Seek help from trusted adults for oneself or a friend with an emotional or social health problem.

FACA57C0DFE30131944E68A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

9AC177C3F12A44AAAF960CB23BCE5E74.description: Evaluate the benefits of professional services for people with mental, emotional, or social health conditions.

68C4D3A88A704D458D33B7088A568AD5.description: Access school and community resources to help with mental, emotional, and social health concerns.

FAC9FBB0DFE30131944D68A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

64D78A4A85764A0E8B615542638097E1.description: Analyze the internal and external issues related to seeking mental health assistance.

FAC9A1E0DFE30131944C68A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FAC8AEA0DFE30131944968A86D17958E.description: Classify personal stressors at home, in school, and with peers.

FAC857B0DFE30131944868A86D17958E.description: Explain how witnesses and bystanders can help prevent violence by reporting dangerous situations.

FAC7ED20DFE30131944768A86D17958E.description: Analyze signs of depression, potential suicide, and other self-destructive behaviors.

FAC77160DFE30131944668A86D17958E.description: Describe the importance of recognizing signs of disordered eating and other common mental health conditions.

FAC70A30DFE30131944568A86D17958E.description: Describe how social environments affect health and well-being.

FAC6B8C0DFE30131944468A86D17958E.description: Describe qualities that contribute to a positive self-image.

FAC66820DFE30131944368A86D17958E.description: Describe healthy ways to express caring, friendship, affection, and love.

FAC60B70DFE30131944268A86D17958E.description: Analyze the qualities of healthy peer and family relationships.

FAC59600DFE30131944168A86D17958E.description: Describe the benefits of having positive relationships with trusted adults.

FAC53710DFE30131944068A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

FAC48FB0DFE30131943E68A86D17958E.description: Present a persuasive solution to the problem of alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use among youths.

FAC43900DFE30131943D68A86D17958E.description: Participate in activities in the school and community that help other individuals make positive choices regarding the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FAC3E920DFE30131943C68A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

FAC39940DFE30131943B68A86D17958E.description: Use effective coping strategies when faced with various social situations involving the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FAC34430DFE30131943A68A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

FAC2E580DFE30131943968A86D17958E.description: Predict how a drug-free lifestyle will support the achievement of short- and long-term goals.

FAC27E70DFE30131943868A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

FAC21E00DFE30131943768A86D17958E.description: Explain healthy alternatives to alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use.

FAC1CE90DFE30131943668A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to evaluate how the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs affects individuals, families, and society.

FAC17D60DFE30131943568A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

FAC12C30DFE30131943468A86D17958E.description: Use effective refusal and negotiation skills to avoid riding in a car or engaging in other risky behaviors with someone who has been using alcohol or other drugs.

FAC0CFE0DFE30131943368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate assertive communication skills to resist pressure to use alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FAC078C0DFE30131943268A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

FAC01900DFE30131943168A86D17958E.description: Evaluate prevention, intervention, and treatment resources and programs concerning alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FABFC170DFE30131943068A86D17958E.description: Access information, products, and services related to the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FABF6A60DFE30131942F68A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FABF12C0DFE30131942E68A86D17958E.description: Describe financial, political, social, and legal influences on the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FABEC200DFE30131942D68A86D17958E.description: Analyze the role of individual, family, community, and cultural norms on the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FABE70A0DFE30131942C68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate strategies for managing the impact of internal and external influences on alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use.

FABE15A0DFE30131942B68A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FABDA670DFE30131942A68A86D17958E.description: Clarify myths regarding the scope of alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use among adolescents.

FABD4880DFE30131942968A86D17958E.description: Explain the impact of alcohol and other drug use on vehicle crashes, injuries, violence, and risky sexual behavior.

FABCEBD0DFE30131942868A86D17958E.description: Interpret school policies and community laws related to alcohol, tobacco, and illegal drug use, possession, and sale.

FABC9E10DFE30131942768A86D17958E.description: Analyze the consequences of binge drinking and its relationship to cancer; to liver, pancreatic, and cardiovascular diseases; and to a variety of gastrointestinal problems, neurological disorders, and reproductive system disorders.

FABC4960DFE30131942668A86D17958E.description: Analyze the consequences for the mother and child of using alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs during pregnancyincluding fetal alcohol spectrum disorders and other birth defects.

FABBF7D0DFE30131942568A86D17958E.description: Describe the use and abuse of prescription and nonprescription medicines and illegal substances.

FABB9CE0DFE30131942468A86D17958E.description: Identify the social and legal implications of using and abusing alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FABB4E60DFE30131942368A86D17958E.description: Explain the connection between alcohol and tobacco use and the risk of oral cancer.

FABAFCD0DFE30131942268A86D17958E.description: Explain the impact of alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use on brain chemistry, brain function, and behavior.

FABAA230DFE30131942168A86D17958E.description: Describe the health benefits of abstaining from or discontinuing use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

FABA2290DFE30131942068A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

FAB97F30DFE30131941E68A86D17958E.description: Encourage actions to promote safe driving experiences.

FAB92E30DFE30131941D68A86D17958E.description: Encourage peers to use safety equipment during physical activity.

FAB8DA40DFE30131941C68A86D17958E.description: Identify and support changes in the home, at school, and in the community that promote safety.

FAB88140DFE30131941B68A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

FAB826C0DFE30131941A68A86D17958E.description: Assess characteristics of harmful or abusive relationships.

FAB7D340DFE30131941968A86D17958E.description: Apply strategies to avoid and report dangerous situations, including conflicts involving weapons and gangs.

FAB77E30DFE30131941868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate first aid and CPR procedures.

FAB72950DFE30131941768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate conflict resolution skills to avoid potentially violent situations.

FAB6D180DFE30131941668A86D17958E.description: Practice injury prevention during athletic, social, and motor vehicle-related activities.

FAB66730DFE30131941568A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

FAB609E0DFE30131941468A86D17958E.description: Develop a plan to prevent injuries during emergencies and natural disasters.

FAB5A370DFE30131941368A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

FAB54070DFE30131941268A86D17958E.description: Analyze the consequences of violence for self, family, and the community.

FAB4DB10DFE30131941168A86D17958E.description: Analyze the consequences of gang involvement for self, family, and the community.

FAB45E00DFE30131941068A86D17958E.description: Analyze the laws regarding and detrimental effects of sexual harassment.

FAB40DA0DFE30131940F68A86D17958E.description: Apply a decision-making process to avoid potentially dangerous situations.

FAB3BDE0DFE30131940E68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

FAB36BE0DFE30131940D68A86D17958E.description: Use effective communication skills for preventing and reporting sexual assault and molestation.

FAB31950DFE30131940C68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate effective negotiation skills for avoiding dangerous and risky situations.

FAB2BC00DFE30131940B68A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

FAB26940DFE30131940A68A86D17958E.description: Analyze community resources for disaster preparedness.

FAB21360DFE30131940968A86D17958E.description: Analyze sources of information and services concerning safety and violence prevention.

FAB1BF70DFE30131940868A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FAB16DD0DFE30131940768A86D17958E.description: Analyze why it is risky to belong to a gang.

FAB11BF0DFE30131940668A86D17958E.description: Explain how one's behavior when traveling as a passenger in a vehicle influences the behavior of others.

FAB0B5A0DFE30131940568A86D17958E.description: Analyze the influence of alcohol and other drug use on personal, family, and community safety.

FAB055D0DFE30131940468A86D17958E.description: Analyze internal and external influences on personal, family, and community safety.

FAAFFA00DFE30131940368A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FAAFA980DFE30131940268A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to prevent situations that might harm vision, hearing, or dental health.

FAAF4B90DFE30131940168A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to stay safe during natural disasters and emergency situations (e.g., landslides, floods, earthquakes, wildfires, electrical storms, winter storms, and terrorist attacks).

FAAEB820DFE30131940068A86D17958E.description: Describe procedures for emergency care and lifesaving, including CPR, first aid, and control of bleeding.

FAAE68C0DFE3013193FF68A86D17958E.description: Explain the effects of violence on individuals, families, and communities.

FAACD220DFE3013193FA68A86D17958E.description: Examine ways that injuries are caused while traveling to and from school and in the community.

FAAC7F10DFE3013193F968A86D17958E.description: Analyze emergency preparedness plans for the home, the school, and the community.

FAAC2550DFE3013193F868A86D17958E.description: Recognize potentially harmful or abusive relationships, including dangerous dating situations.

FAABC0A0DFE3013193F768A86D17958E.description: Discuss ways to reduce the risk of injuries that can occur during athletic and social activities.

FAAB52B0DFE3013193F668A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.
